x

We’re answering the most common questions on fur storage,
care & and our in-store offerings.

How should I store my fur coat?

Hang your fur on a contoured hanger to protect the shape and fit.
Give your fur enough room in the closet so it doesn't get crushed.
Avoid leaving your fur in bright places; light can oxidate the fur.
Never use chemical mothproof sprays, mothballs or cedar chips.

Can I store my fur in a plastic bag?

No—plastic prevents air from circulating and can dry out the leather.

What should I do when traveling?

Store your fur in a deluxe garment bag.
Shoulder bags and seatbelts can rub fur and break off guard hairs. Ask about a shoulder guard!

How do I maintain the fur's beauty?

Keep your fur away from direct heat; blow dryers and radiators can cause fur and leather to dry out.
Avoid spraying perfume or hairspray immediately before slipping into your coat.
Never pin jewelry on your fur.

What if my fur gets wet?

SHake it off and hang it up to dry in a well-ventilated room.

What are your in-store services?

Keep your fur just like new...
Storage
Regardless of where your coats were purchased, our advanced climate-controlled vault can extend the life of your furs and keep them protected during warmer months.
Repairs, relining & alterations
Whether it's a torn seam, loose lining or missing hook, our professionals can take care of your repair and alteration needs.
Restyling
Update the fur you love for a fresh and modern look. Stretch the value of the coat, by having it restyled by one of our specialists—from heirloom to haute fashion. Simply adjust the length, shoulders, sleeves and more, or completely change the design: transform a coat into a jacket, vest or even fur trim on a cape.
Vectra®
With this protector, the lining will become stronger and last longer.
Cleaning & conditioning
Your fur needs pampering, too. To keep the fur soft and supple, and prevent it from drying, bring in any fur to have it professionally cleaned and conditioned.
Trade-ins
If your fur coat doesn't qualify for a restyle, trade it in and save on your new fur purchase.
Silk Glow®
This glazing process will protect the fur from harsh elements and keep it clean and lustrous.
Protection plan
Reconditioning
Monogramming

Can't wait? Checkout our online collection!

FAQs

We’re answering the most common questions on fur storage, care & our in-store offerings.

How should I store my fur coat?

Hang your fur on a contoured hanger to protect the shape and fit.
Give your fur enough room in the closet so it doesn't get crushed.
Avoid leaving your fur in bright places; light can oxidate the fur.
Never use chemical mothproof sprays, mothballs or cedar chips.

Can I store my fur in a plastic bag?

No—plastic prevents air from circulating and can dry out the leather.

What should I do when traveling?

Store your fur in a deluxe garment bag.
Shoulder bags and seatbelts can rub fur and break off guard hairs. Ask about a shoulder guard!

How do I maintain the fur's beauty?

Keep your fur away from direct heat; blow dryers and radiators can cause fur and leather to dry out.
Avoid spraying perfume or hairspray immediately before slipping into your coat.
Never pin jewelry on your fur.

What if my fur gets wet?

SHake it off and hang it up to dry in a well-ventilated room.

What are your in-store services?

Keep your fur just like new...
Storage
Regardless of where your coats were purchased, our advanced climate-controlled vault can extend the life of your furs and keep them protected during warmer months.
Repairs, relining & alterations
Whether it's a torn seam, loose lining or missing hook, our professionals can take care of your repair and alteration needs.
Restyling
Update the fur you love for a fresh and modern look. Stretch the value of the coat, by having it restyled by one of our specialists—from heirloom to haute fashion. Simply adjust the length, shoulders, sleeves and more, or completely change the design: transform a coat into a jacket, vest or even fur trim on a cape.
Vectra®
With this protector, the lining will become stronger and last longer.
Cleaning & conditioning
Your fur needs pampering, too. To keep the fur soft and supple, and prevent it from drying, bring in any fur to have it professionally cleaned and conditioned.
Trade-ins
If your fur coat doesn't qualify for a restyle, trade it in and save on your new fur purchase.
Silk Glow®
This glazing process will protect the fur from harsh elements and keep it clean and lustrous.
